p: Time-kill assays were performed to explore the cell viability (kill-time) of EC-G and EC-I essential oil, and the results were articulated as a logarithm of viable counts ( Figure 2). Non-treated E. coli exhibited growth from 5.24 to 8.32 log 10 CFU/mL and moved into the static phase after 8 h. After treatment with EC-G, E. coli growth decreased dramatically in the first 8 h and retained steadily at approximately 3.45 × log 10 CFU/mL, whereas EC-I treatment decreased the growth in the first 8 h and retained steadily at approximately 2.99 × log 10 CFU/mL, suggesting a stronger EC-I killing efficacy against E. coli.
